questions.question: What is the purpose of the <!DOCTYPE> declaration in HTML?
answers: To declare the document type and version
To define the main structure of the HTML document
To include JavaScript in the HTML file
questions.correctAnswer: To declare the document type and version

questions.question: Which HTML tag is used to define an unordered list?
What is the correct syntax for creating a hyperlink?
Which HTML attribute specifies an alternative text for an image?
What is the semantic tag for marking up the main content of a web page?
Which tag is used to create a table in HTML?
What is the default display property of a <div> element?
Which input type is used to select multiple options?
What is the purpose of the <head> element in HTML?
answers: To contain metadata and links to external resources
To define the title of the document
questions.correctAnswer: To contain metadata and links to external resources

questions.question: Which HTML tag is used to embed a video?
What is the correct syntax for applying a background color in CSS?
Which property is used to change the text color in CSS?
What is the default position property value in CSS?
Which CSS property is used to control the layout of a flex container?
Which pseudo-class selects an element when the mouse hovers over it?
What does the z-index property control?
answers: The position of an element in a flexbox

questions.question: Which property is used to create space between the border and the content of an element?
How do you apply a style to an element with a specific id in CSS?
Which value is used with the display property to create a grid layout?
What is the difference between relative and absolute positioning?
answers: Relative positions elements relative to their parent; absolute positions elements relative to the viewport.
Relative positions elements relative to the viewport; absolute positions elements relative to their parent.
Relative and absolute positioning have the same behavior.
Relative positions elements in fixed positions; absolute positions elements freely.
questions.correctAnswer: Relative positions elements relative to their parent; absolute positions elements relative to the viewport.

questions.question: What is the difference between var, let, and const?
answers: They are different variable types in other languages.
var is globally scoped, let is block scoped, and const is for constants.
All three are identical in usage.
const can only be used for numbers.
questions.correctAnswer: var is globally scoped, let is block scoped, and const is for constants.

questions.question: What is a closure in JavaScript?
answers: A function with access to its own scope, parent scope, and the global scope.
A data structure for asynchronous programming.
questions.correctAnswer: A function with access to its own scope, parent scope, and the global scope.

questions.question: Which method is used to iterate over arrays?
What is the difference between == and ===?
answers: Both check for equality with the same behavior.
== compares values, === compares values and types.
== compares strings only, === compares numbers only.
== is for assignment, === is for comparison.
questions.correctAnswer: == compares values, === compares values and types.

questions.question: What does the Array.prototype.reduce() method do?
answers: Iterates over an array to find the maximum value.
Executes a reducer function on each element, resulting in a single output.
questions.correctAnswer: Executes a reducer function on each element, resulting in a single output.

questions.question: What does the 'this' keyword refer to?
answers: The global object in any context.
The object that owns the currently executing code.
A fixed reference to the window object.
questions.correctAnswer: The object that owns the currently executing code.

questions.question: What are promises in JavaScript?
answers: An object representing the eventual completion or failure of an asynchronous operation.
A data type for storing strings.
A method for looping over arrays.
questions.correctAnswer: An object representing the eventual completion or failure of an asynchronous operation.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the async/await syntax?
answers: To handle asynchronous operations more elegantly.
questions.correctAnswer: To handle asynchronous operations more elegantly.

questions.question: What is the output of: console.log(typeof null)?
What is the purpose of the event loop in JavaScript?
answers: To handle asynchronous code and events.
questions.correctAnswer: To handle asynchronous code and events.

questions.question: What is web accessibility?
answers: A feature for increasing website speed
The practice of making websites usable by people with disabilities
An optimization technique for search engines
questions.correctAnswer: The practice of making websites usable by people with disabilities

questions.question: Which HTML attribute is used to describe the purpose of an image?
What does ARIA stand for?
Which role should be used to define a navigation bar in ARIA?
How can you make a form label accessible?
answers: Using the 'for' attribute to link the label to its input
Placing the label inside the input field
Using the 'title' attribute on the input field
Leaving the label as plain text
questions.correctAnswer: Using the 'for' attribute to link the label to its input

questions.question: Which HTML element is commonly used to provide alternative text for non-text content?
What is the purpose of the 'tabindex' attribute?
answers: To specify the tab order of elements
To style tabs in a webpage
questions.correctAnswer: To specify the tab order of elements

questions.question: Which WCAG principle ensures that content is usable with a keyboard?
How can you ensure that a video is accessible?
answers: By embedding it in an iframe

questions.question: What is the main goal of semantic HTML?
answers: To define the meaning and structure of web content
questions.correctAnswer: To define the meaning and structure of web content
